snippet: Mary Jo White, the new chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, has gotten off on the wrong foot.
abstract: Editorial expresses disappointment with Mary Jo White, new chairwoman of Securities and Exchange Commission, for leading commissioners in her first vote in approving proposal that could leave investors and taxpayers exposed to reckless derivatives trading by banks; calls for stronger regulations on such trading.
lead_paragraph: Mary Jo White, the new chairwoman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, has gotten off on the wrong foot.

headline.seo: A Disappointing Debut at the S.E.C.

keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
